alert.note: Alert for Halifax; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 1:55PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A heavy shower with strong wind gusts will impact portions of southeastern Warren, north central Nash, northwestern Halifax and eastern Franklin Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 153 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a heavy shower 14 miles northwest of Dortches, or 14 miles north of Nashville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Littleton, Arcola, Medoc Mountain State Park, Aventon and Airlie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this shower. Low- hanging, rotating clouds may result.
